name: Mozambique
description: Mozambique is a southeastern African nation bordering the Indian Ocean. It’s known for its stunning coastline, diverse wildlife, and rich cultural heritage. The country has a complex history marked by Portuguese colonization and a long struggle for independence, culminating in a peaceful transition in 1975. Today, Mozambique is a developing nation focused on economic growth and sustainable development, while preserving its natural beauty and cultural traditions.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Mozambique is the 34th largest country in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Its vast territory encompasses diverse landscapes, from coastal plains to mountainous highlands.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population is largely concentrated along the coast.
quickFacts.detail: The official language is Portuguese, but numerous local languages are spoken.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Maputo is the economic and political center of Mozambique.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a vibrant port city with a rich history and culture.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Mozambican Metical is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, and it's advisable to check current rates before traveling.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Mozambique's economy is heavily reliant on natural resources.
quickFacts.detail: Agriculture, tourism, and mining are key sectors.

climateData.title: Climate of Mozambique
climateData.description: Mozambique experiences a tropical climate with significant regional variations. The coastal areas are hot and humid year-round, while inland regions have distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is characterized by heavy rainfall, flooding, and high humidity. It’s a time of lush vegetation and abundant wildlife.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings cooler temperatures, lower humidity, and less rainfall. It’s an ideal time for exploring national parks and beaches.

naturalWonders.name: Gorongosa National Park
naturalWonders.description: Gorongosa National Park is a remarkable recovery story. Devastated by civil war in the 1990s, it’s now undergoing a massive restoration effort, boasting incredible biodiversity and wildlife populations. It’s a testament to the resilience of nature and the power of conservation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a vast area of savanna, woodland, and riverine habitats, supporting a diverse range of animals including elephants, lions, leopards, rhinos, and numerous bird species. Ongoing research and conservation programs are crucial to its long-term survival.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for optimal experience

naturalWonders.name: Bweca Archipelago
naturalWonders.description: The Bweca Archipelago, located off the coast of Pemba, is a stunning collection of islands and coral reefs teeming with marine life. It’s a paradise for divers and snorkelers, offering a glimpse into a pristine underwater world.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The islands are characterized by white-sand beaches, turquoise waters, and lush vegetation. The surrounding coral reefs provide habitat for a vast array of fish, turtles, and other marine creatures. The area is also home to several endemic bird species.
viewingTips: Book a diving or snorkeling tour

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Mozambique
ecosystemData.overview: Mozambique’s diverse ecosystems range from coastal mangrove forests and coral reefs to savanna grasslands, miombo woodlands, and mountainous highlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, playing a vital role in the country’s biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Mozambique’s coastline is home to a vibrant marine ecosystem, including coral reefs, mangrove forests, and seagrass beds.

statistics.details: Supports a diverse range of marine life
Provides critical habitat for fish and birds

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Migrates to Mozambican waters for breeding

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Mozambique’s savanna ecosystems are characterized by grasslands, woodlands, and scattered trees, supporting a wide range of herbivores and predators.

statistics.details: One of the largest elephant populations in Southern Africa

activities.description: Mozambique offers a wide range of activities for travelers, from wildlife safaris and diving to cultural experiences and beach relaxation.
